111.content:
Anna hesitated before finding something sharp in her bab. "In the wrist?" She couldn't take it. Why? What had she done wrong for her boyfriend to turn around and start dating her friend? She pulled out a piece of glass. "My pictur frame must of broke." She sighed. Maybe there was a way out of this. Maybe there wasn't. She heard the bathroom door open and she hugged her knees so no one could see her legs. It was her friend. She finished doing her job and Anna heard her boyfriend's voice say, "C'mon babe. Wait until 7:00. I'll pick you up." Then the door slammed shut. Anna wanted to run after them. She wanted to kill her friend for having a way to turn anybody on. Anna looked at her wrist. Maybe she'd be happy if she just forgot about the whole thing and died. She didn't know what to do. She was too young to die. Her parents would go mad. At least her friend would feel bad. Anna smiled at the thought. Well, I guess it's time to pull the plug. Suddenly, her stall flung open. She had forgotten to lock it.
"Come with me Anna." It was a girl Anna barely knew. Her brown hair was shining like there was light above it, but there was no light besides the on in the bathroom. The girl took her hand and they walked out the door. "Anna, I want to show you something." Anna peeered through the jacket the girl had flung on her. It was her friend. She looked so hysterical as she cried her eyes out. Her boyfriend was there too. What happened? Suddenly, Anna understood. This was the flash of the future. If she had killed herself, this would've happened. Anna walked up to her boyfriend and hugged him. He didn't budge. He didn't even look at her. So much for TLC! Her friend rubbed her shoulders as Anna said, "You guys!" "Did you hear something?" Her boyfriend shook his head. Anna glared at the girl that had taken her here. "Take me back. I don't want to die. I hate the silent treatment." The girl obeyed. They were back in the stall. Anna raced out but there was noone there. "Anna, you have to decide your future. Don't die because of one boy. God has plans for you." Anna turned around. The girl had wings, white leathery wings that were accompanying her white dress. She had a crown. "I'm your gaurdian angel." Anna pinched herself. It was real. "Ok gaurdian angel. Why weren't you there all the times I needed you? My homework, my dog died, the day my uncle moved to Genovia..." The angel laughed. "I can't stop what has already happened. I can't stop the future. I can only stop you." Then she dissapeared.

Anna, a glint in her blue eye, stares right up at her "boyfriend". They were friends one time, weren't they?

"Jack, about you and Jessica, what happened between us?" Anna asked dramatically, her face steady and her emotions subsided. Jack looked at her blankly. "Why did you just leave me without warning and move on like I never existed?"

Jack paused at her boldness, even though he knew that Anna wasn't the type to take things as they came. He hadn't expected her to be this outright. But then, what had he expected? Not this, for sure. He thought quick.

"Anna, I know that you and Jessica are friends and stuff, but did you really expect our relationship to go on?" he asked. It was pretty desperate, though he was out of explanations.

"No," Anna admitted evenly, "but I had hoped that, if it did end, it wouldn't be like this! How could you do this to me? Why did you do this to me? Did you think I wouldn't be hurt?"

"Anna," Jack began as Anna turned away.

Total RECAP by the Shadow, SoapySuds and Lord Robbie

“Anna! Anna, are you okay?" Anna heard a voice call out. It didn't sound too familiar, but she managed to stop crying. She wiped her tears away, got up and turned around. "Anna..." "Ginger?" Anna asked, "What are you doing here?" "I have a hall pass..." Ginger seemed a bit frightened, pausing to choose her words carefully. Anna took advantage of the stop in this potential discussion to examine the girl. Ginger was a sophomore, that Anna knew when she was a little kid. They lived in the same neighbourhood and every once in a while when they were younger, they would get together and hang out. Ginger was always an inquisitive girl, but also very funny making Anna laugh. She would always bring the tastiest sweets or even bring her mother’s makeup kit.

But ever since they hit junior high, everything changed. It was completely different. Anna was one year older than Ginger. Ginger grew taller though, her body filled out faster and she became broody. Almost like she resented Anna for something. As time went on, they both drifted apart. And now by some quirk of fate, they were reunited. "What's wrong? And what are you doing here?" asked Ginger. "It's my boyfriend --” "I don't have a boyfriend," Ginger interrupted, "Do you know how lucky you are?" Anna sighed. "He's cheating on me," Anna said. "Oh no!" Ginger said, "That's horrible! What a jerk! Tell me his name, so I can give him a big kick in his tiny balls!" Anna giggled at that. Ginger was still funny. Ginger suggested "Why don't you go to the nurse?" “The nurse? Why would I do that?” enquired Anna. "Well," Ginger began tentatively, "Why don't you fake some kinda disease or something? You could go to the nurse. You look teary-eyed enough, you know."

Anna blushed at that. “I mean you’re still gorgeous, I just meant…” "Ummm...no thanks Ginger, but thanks. I think I'll head to my locker and get my art stuff. The bell rings soon and art is my next class." "Suit yourself." Ginger replied. "Yeah, but thanks." Anna admitted. Ginger seemed upset as she turned towards the door. Ginger took a few steps before Anna stopped her. "Ginger!" she yelled. Ginger turned around and looked at Anna, a small smile appearing on her face. Anna didn't say anything for a while, but Ginger was still curious on what Anna wanted to tell her. "Umm, Ginger," Anna started, walking a little bit closer to her, "Would you like to come to our house for dinner tonight? I mean, for old times’ sake and stuff...and well...I miss having you around. Can you come?? Pleease?" Ginger stood there thinking about it for a while, her smile growing. "Ummm," she started "I think I can come...yup, I can come! I can't wait! It'll be just like old times...right Anna?" she concluded, a nervousness in her expression. Anna stopped and thought again for a minute, remembering Ginger’s broodiness.

And then she smiled as the taller, nervous, younger girl. "Yup," she said, "It will." Anna and Ginger returned to class, Anna’s thoughts no longer on her cheating boyfriend, now about her former friend. They met up after school ended. Ginger walked and talked with Anna for more than 2 hours. Anna couldn’t recall when she last laughed so much. Ginger really was a funny girl. All of sudden, seemingly without prompting Ginger leaned in, starting to gently kiss Anna on her velvety lips. Anna’s eyes widened, surprised at these unexpected change of events. Before she closed her eyes and returned the kiss. Ginger was beautiful, funny and she was there. Anna would have done something stupid, but for her. "This was fate!" thought Anna as she felt Ginger hold her. Ginger was hands down the best kisser who had ever kissed Anna. Of course, that just meant she was better than Jack, but by such a huge margin that it made Jack's attempts look like vampirism by comparison.
12111121111.title: Total Recap

"It's iron alloy rather than ceramic plastic. The iron from the cauldron stimulates the chemical compound. We need to wait for a few more seconds." explained Ginger. Anna could only nod as Ginger ran her gloved hand across her lab coat sleeve. Anna shivered, filling delicious feelings as heat rose to her face and down below. "You're getting slippery, aren't you?" The tree cages joined and the two females were now together. Anna gasped again as both rats clawed at each other with obvious lustful abandon. "Now watch the boy rat!" Anna observed the excitement of the male rat, clearly enjoying the show. It seemed lesbianism attracted all males regardless of species.

"Jack," she began, "I really love you, but-"

Before she could finish her sentence, he had seized her - one arm round her waist, the other holding the back of her head - and started kissing her. He walked her over to the the wall so that her back was against it, and continued to kiss her neck, her cheek and her forehead. But Anna found herself not kissing him back - partly because he didn't usually do this, making her feel slightly unnerved, and partly because she still wanted to talk about Jessica.
"Jack, listen," she said softly, pushing him away, and continuing with what she had started to say earlier. "I really love you, but in a relationship we have to be honest with each other-"
He interrupted again. "Are you saying I'm not being honest?" he asked in the same gruff voice he had used before. "Are you, Anna?"

141112.content:
Anna sat in the back seat quietly. Her dad didn't say anything until they were out of the school's parking lot.
"What the FUCK happened?!" He yelled, his gorgeous face turning red.
Her father was only thirty, and he was a handsome man. Her parents had divorced, leaving Anna with her father. She bitterly resented the decision until she learnt why her fantastic mum had done so.
"Look, I just didn't feel like..." She trailed off. Her dad didn't say another word. He just drove on, carefully not saying anything or letting his face betray his true emotions.
As soon as they were home, Anna got out of the car and ran up to the lift. Her dad reached her side after a few moments. They travelled up to the apartment in complete silence.
Once inside the apartment, her father took out his whisky. It was a beautiful, cold, modern apartment. Her father had left her mother with no money- that's why she couldn't have Anna.
"You stupid, stupid little fucking BITCH!" Her father hissed, setting down his glass. Anna began shaking in fear.
Her father advanced, his eyes narrowing, an evil smile creeping onto his lips.
"We'll have to punish you, won't we?" He came up to her until they were almost nose to nose. Anna's eyes were wide and frightened. Her father smiled, cupped her face and began kissing her.
"Ugh, Dad!" She pushed him away in disgust. Her father got angry. He grabbed her arm, leading her to his bedroom. He sat her on the bed, slapping her on the face. Anna began crying.
"Shut the fuck up!" He hissed again. Anna stopped crying, and wiped her tears. Her father picked her up, wiping her tears away from her mouth, and kissed her again. She tried to push him away again.
"You little bitch!" He laughed. He slapped her hard, and started rustling around in his cupboard. She made a move to stand up. He pushed her back down and slapped her again. Anna bitterly tried not to cry. He found whatever it was he was looking for. It was cold in his room. She began shivering.
